bibl.title: Mary E. Teller v. Franklin Teller. Frank Graves Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.
Multiple case files included with habeas petition

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane } SS
In District Court of 4th Judicial District Holding Terms at Spokane Falls
Mary E Teller vs Franklin Teller
Territory of Washington County of Spokane } SS

Frank Graves being first duly sworn on his oath states that he is one of the attorneys for plaintiff in the above entitled action and is of his own knowledge personally familiar with the evidence relied upon and to be offered by plaintiff to support the cause of action of importance in said complaint

That the testimony will be by plaintiff and a physician and is of a kind not fit to be rendered in open court and which plaintiff should not be required to give in open court: that plaintiff is an ignorant woman and can express only in the common only in phrases as to such matters that she is only and exceedingly to compelled to testify in open court as to said cause of action that plaintiff claims defendant was hereby able to effect question and at no time during their married life had that the of evidence
as given by plaintiff are exceedingly embarassing to her and disgusting to the husband and affiant believes said evidence should be given before a defense or others therein open court both out of consideration to plaintiff and her family and in in the interest of public morals
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22nd day of December 1886
